website_summaries.verdict: A durable litter box that's both self-cleaning and affordable.
pros: Self-cleaning design means no more scooping cat litter by hand
it also increases the longevity of your litter
Uses no electricity – simply roll the box to initiate self-cleaning
Sits at a low price point despite being made from quality materials
cons: Overfilling the litter makes the self-clean feature less effective

customer_reviews.title: It's alright.
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient as far as getting the waste out, but when doing a full litter change it's a little annoying. Overall, it's much better than scooping from a regular litter box. I don't regret the purchase. The thing is massive as well, just a heads up. It takes up way more space than I anticipated.
customer_reviews.author: joshua

customer_reviews.title: Pros and cons
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these before and I loved it. This unit has a different clip and it doesn't snap all the way shut (the older unit had slide locks) the result is when I tip the litter box over it spills litter out. The unit is a nice litter box and the litter tracker on the front is a great idea. Pro: Great Size Lip on the front to trap litter is a great idea Easy to use - if the snaps work Con: The inside screen slips out of place. The latch on the back is hard to keep secured and when you tip the unit litter spills.
customer_reviews.author: CSKET

customer_reviews.title: Excellent alternative to traditional scooping
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats and I love this litter box. One of my cats has kidney problems and his urine clumps are huge, so I scoop.. a lot. To handle any sticky urine clumps I gently hit the bottom of the box once it is turned over. Since the box has a cover refilling can be a challenge. I remove the waste collection scoop and fill it with clean litter and dump it in. This method makes topping off the box easier.
customer_reviews.author: JAC

customer_reviews.title: Throw your scooper away forever
customer_reviews.text: This is simply the best litter box out there. It just works as described. Roll it over, then back, pull out the drawer and dump into the trash. It couldn't be any easier and cleaner. Plus, it looks as sharp for a litter box.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Puski

customer_reviews.title: Easy easy easy to use
customer_reviews.text: After all these years and all the cat boxes I've used I have finaly found the best one, this cat box does exactly what it said it does, Just roll and roll back...that's it...I would buy this again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Gmac

customer_reviews.title: Does not work without a lot of misses and messes.
customer_reviews.text: My mother moved in with us at the age of 87 along with her cat. Nice enough cat but I am not crazy about cat litter boxes so I upgrades my mother's cat litter box since I clean it. It worked once without a problem. That was the only time it worked without taking it apart a thousand times (each time dumping little on the floor). I would have to take it all apart and put it back together trying to get the thing in alignment so it wouldn't dump. Yesterday it took six times and I finally just cleaned it like I used to do to the old box. Money wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: So much better than 'traditional' boxes.
customer_reviews.text: If you can get it at the $50 price point, you'll love this. The other models tended to have some leakage from the seam on the tip-over, but this seems good so far. The scoop is HUGE, which also combats the biggest problem with these units - how to refill them. Answer: pour the litter in the scoop instead of directly into the hole. I bought one medium sized model, and liked it so much, that I picked up three of the Elite's, and the cleaning ritual is SO much faster.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Avoid at ALL costs!
customer_reviews.text: What a waste of money! Like a dummy, I fell in love with the concept and a few reviews and bought three delux models for my four cats. Many design flaws especially the slide out tray that doesn’t fit well AND the box does not seal well every time and loose litter escapes from the sides no-matter how careful I am to line up the two halves and snap the closers. When cat litter boxes seem too good to be true, they usually are! Don’t ‘flush’ you money down the toilet! The best litter boxes are large/jumbo, covered and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: joseph anthony

customer_reviews.title: better latches on this model.
customer_reviews.text: I already own one of the older versions. I love the way it works and the concept. except the older one leaked where the top and the bottom come together. was always a little messy. but still better than older style boxes. this one seems alot better as far as the fasteners go. Since I know my cats already like their BOX this should be an easy adjustment for them. I am hopeful this ELITE version will be less mess when I roll. Still testing that. as far as the CHROME latches. Really? the chrome is already off 3 of the latches. It is not ELITE in that regard and I wouldn't purchase it because of that.
customer_reviews.author: tb

customer_reviews.title: I love this litter box
customer_reviews.text: I love this litter box! No more scooping! Roll it over, bang on the bottom roll it back then pull out the drawer empty and that’s it!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Cook

customer_reviews.title: Large enough and roomy for the cats
customer_reviews.text: After initial inspection by my two cats, they seem to keep reusing it. I think it's a hit They seem to like the privacy. It's hard to put together but I think we figured it out.. After a day or so, I rolled the Omega Paw Elite Unit over pursuant to instructions,and (viola!!) I pulled a drawer out and the waste had been deposited neatly inside. What a time saver! Even my husband who refuses to perform normally unpleasant litterbox duty was impressed. I Hope the person who patented this time and mess saver litter box was able to retire and live a life of luxury forevermore. This product is well worth the expense.
customer_reviews.author: Zippy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t really work
customer_reviews.text: I am not at all happy with this box. I’ve tried it for a month, tried different litters. The part that collects the waste should have slits in it. Since it doesn’t litter gets caught in it and wasted. Wet pee gets stuck in the slats and broken up and smells terrible. It doesn’t collect all the waste because of how the waste pan part sits in there. It’s just a waste of time and effort and bad design. I’m going to switch to a good sifting pan.
customer_reviews.author: CJaneTyp

customer_reviews.title: Works very well when assembled correctly and not overfilled
customer_reviews.text: Works well, if you take care to ensure it's sealed properly and don't over-fill it. The negative reviews seem to be from people who didn't make sure it was sealed and/or overfilled. If you overfill it, litter will spill out when it's rotated. The manufacturing tolerances aren't as precise as they could be, so it can take a few tries to snap the latches into place, sealing the top half to the bottom half. They are more irregular than they should be, but with attention and care, you will get the hang of it and not have problems.
customer_reviews.author: I Chose Hampture

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: The self cleaning litter Box, is not that bad. The only thing is that the drawer moves, so when I'm turning the litter I have to be also keeping a hand on the drawer so it doesn't open and it's kind of hard. Some times the poop goes under the drawer or in the very far corner and when you empty the drawer the poop stays there. So I empty the drawer and repeat the process.
customer_reviews.author: Corina Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: Completely worthless.
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made, latching is difficult because plastic is flimsy. The sifting mechanism has you dumping more clean litter than clumps and since it doesn't go together we'll litter seeps out the edges and around the drawer whenever you told it. I'll stick to Rubbermaid containers as recommended by several vets, though I was hoping the "easy" cleaning of this one would help my elderly cat with bathroom "issues*. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sassy Thornback

customer_reviews.title: Not bad really
customer_reviews.text: Despite issues some people seem to have with this, it is working pretty good. If your cat is just a normal cat, that digs a hole, does his business, and then covers it up, then this will work fine. Just roll it to the right till it stops, then roll it back enough to let the litter go back where it belongs, and its set till the next day. Mine fit together well, doesn't leak anything, and works like it should. The latches being plastic should probably be available to purchase separately, but other than that there is nothing to break. Probably need a jumbo model for really large cats though.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bess

customer_reviews.title: My husband HATES litter boxes and he was excited about this one!
customer_reviews.text: This box has made my life so much easier! It takes about ten seconds to clean the whole thing. It can spill some litter out while cleaning if it's too full so make sure to heed the max fill line inside. As long as your cat doesn't have runny poop or pees direclty on the sides/corners you wont have to clean by hand very often. I clean it daily, open it weekly to fill the litter, and spot clean/fully clean when needed. We've had this box for 6 months now and I've already converted 2 coworkers. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: S.Bianchi

customer_reviews.title: She's getting older and really disliked bending over to poop scoop all the old boxes
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a game changer for my mom. She's getting older and really disliked bending over to poop scoop all the old boxes. This thing does work. You can't put too much litter in it or you'll get some in the removal basin, but it's pretty neat to see the litter slide over, the clumps stay behind, and then get deposited in the basin. It's handy and it works, it's just a little clunky, and messy if you accidently have a bit of an angle and some spills out the opening.
customer_reviews.author: Lucifer Faust

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work at all. I tried rolling it five times before it started leaking litter out the back. The one time the tray caught anything, it was mostly unused litter and only half of the waste. Plus my cat hated the sound and bit me. Don't waste your money. Save up and get robotic self cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Emi

customer_reviews.title: I would highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: This is the answer to all of my litter box issues! I have four cats, and it was taking me 30 minutes a day to scoop my boxes. I bought these Roll 'n Clean boxes in hopes of making the process more speedy, and it has done just that! I can now take care of ALL my litter boxes in less than the time it took for me to scoop just one traditional box! I would highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Laura C.

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy peasy as described
customer_reviews.text: It's not a quick roll to get it to filter - you have to tilt it sideways (not as easy as it sounds), let the litter fall through the grate, then tilt it even more (almost halfway to upside-down) to get the clumps to fall to the side - but even then, the clumps don't all go. The grate slats are wide enough that some waste pieces get stuck, resulting in only a half-clean each time. The clasps that hold it stuck feel fragile and are hard to snap into place, so I'm scared to disassemble it for a proper cleaning for fear they'll snap. It's a neat concept, but poorly executed.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Leota

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS! LOVE THIS BOX!
customer_reviews.text: This is so easy to assemble and use. It does exacly as described. You roll it over upside down and I pat the bottom so any stubborn urine clumps come out. Turn it back again and clean litter covers the bottom. Then, ALL the refuse comes out in the drawer!! I simply pull out the drawer and empty into my Cat Genie. My cats love it. I got the larger size and loved it so much, that I got the smaller size for kittens. The smaller version would be good for someone with just one cat too. I really can’t understand the negative reviews. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Home Zoo

customer_reviews.title: Not good if you want your cats in a cleaner litter environment
customer_reviews.text: After using this for a week I noticed that the daily rolling of the box doesn't clean well. Yes, the largest clumps and poops fall into the tray but there is still waste left behind plus the roof is coated with dust from the rolling motion. Also, cleaning this box is a hassle with all the extra parts. I'm going to stick with the old fashioned way of raking the litter myself.
customer_reviews.author: BarefootD

customer_reviews.title: Good litterbox, no big issues so far after 2+ years..
customer_reviews.text: I always buy this litterbox.. Just roll and get rid of waste from drawer. I don't have any issues as of 2+ years of use for a cat. The only gripe I have is that it's bulky but it's better than having an open litterbox.. I used a honeycomb mat to trap the litter. Note: only use clumping litter, you may have to occasionally scrape the litter from the box but still not a bad litterbox.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied buyer in Orlando, FL

customer_reviews.title: The idea was good
customer_reviews.text: This was a good idea if it had worked right. This is now just a covered litter box with a window at my house. The unit is quite large and we had to pull it out to roll it. The scoop wall would take in bits that should have been in the tray. Our try just sat there and was a concern when rolled over. Bits would get stuck between the tray and the shelf it sat on so I had to use a poop scoop anyway. The look of this box is very nice but I feel like I could have saved money and just bought a covered little box.
customer_reviews.author: Tali

customer_reviews.title: Big Mess!
customer_reviews.text: Initially this was okay. By about the third litter change the thing was leaking litter all over, couldn’t get the sides to line up properly or latches to stay latched. Drawer was difficult to get in and out to dump poop and litter seeping out of sides every time it was rocked to collect poop. Have seen reviews where people ended up screwing the lid and base together to prevent leaks but shouldn’t have to do that if it was designed properly. Finally gave up and took off lid and used like every other classic type litter box. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Franks

customer_reviews.title: Clip broke, too much money for a product that is crummy.
customer_reviews.text: I heard about this product from a friend who loves it. I was surprised by the relatively poor quality of the clips for a box you flip. I had a hard time clasping them. The back clip wouldn’t stay clipped and actually broke after the second flip and empty. Not all of the cat poop/pee makes it to the container- that’s not a deal breaker at all because it does get most of it. But the darn clips! The second flip didn’t work at all. Drawer filled with litter and poo and pee stayed in the box (I may have over filled). Eh, I really wanted to like it, but it isn’t at all worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: nssens

customer_reviews.title: Good for awhile.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this box for about 9 months. It worked great to start with, although the drawer never wanted to stay in place. Still I liked it. As time went on the drawer became more of an issue and the clamps wouldn’t stay closed when you roll it over. Litter would go everywhere. I now have to replace it. Can’t find one I like better so I may just try another. It’s a fantastic idea that just needs a better way to keep parts working right.
customer_reviews.author: rittze

customer_reviews.title: Great for cat privacy
customer_reviews.text: We have two of these to service our two five month old kittens. They took to them as soon as they were set up and have not had any "accidents" anywhere else. It's a good, sturdy product with one slight flaw. The screen tends to work it's way out of the two channels after several "flushings". We've had similar results with previous boxes. Maybe the channels need to be deeper. But overall, a great and attractive product.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth G. Marx

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Broke almost immediately it’s my own fault that I didn’t contact anyone to do something about it so this is not a bad customer service review but this product was terrible good in theory but the plastic grate that is supposed to be the screen for the litter clumps cracked the first day I took it out of the box and it wouldn’t stay in the slots on the bottom of the box when I rolled it so the system couldn’t work properly but that is bad business to have shipped a product out like that period
customer_reviews.author: America Franko

customer_reviews.title: Thought it was going to be a time saver but it wasn't.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the concept of the product but the actual design and execution was poorly done. The poop catcher on the right side didnt hug the side of the lid so the poop would go in between the catcher and the wall. The poop catcher doesnt touch the walls at all and the poop had a tendency to not even go into the catcher. When my cat pees it goes to the bottom of the bin and it would get stuck and i would have to pry it off with a scooper. Smaller pieces of poop would go through the little fence. Would not reccomend anyone to buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy! Litter sticks. But love the idea.
customer_reviews.text: Love the no scooping but VERY heavy and difficult to roll around in my small bathroom. I will also have to try different litter because the Elsey's I use sticks to the corners terribly and this makes it REALLY difficult to get all the clumps out without using a scooper to at least loosen it. Update I have learned to gently flex the plastic when it is upside down to loosen any clumps stuck to the side or bottom.
customer_reviews.author: BA

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. We have four cats, constantly going through litter because it was cleaner to dump out the box instead of scooping. It is so simple! All we have to do is roll it, then throw away the poop. It saves so much litter!!!! Which means saving money! We are able to do it a couple of times a day, takes less than 5 minutes. I highly recommend to anyone. The only thing I wish is that it had a door to prevent the cats from kicking out any litter. **update*** bought a second one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cool but i wouldnt do it again.
customer_reviews.text: Pros -Most reliable out of all "self cleaning" litter boxes. -Not difficult to roll. -Not hard to put together. -Depending on your litter it may not catch everything. -You don't have to smell the litter. -Cat is cool with it. Cons -Plastic could have been higher quality for 50 bucks. -Still messy -rolling it once doesnt dispose of all waste -full litter change is worse than a regular box. - it is gigantic - rolling it isnt that much easier than scooping - quality could be like way better.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L

customer_reviews.title: Great improvements on the design
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth Omega Paw Roll 'n Clean and thank god they fixed those closures. Previously, they used these little slider tabs to hold the top on, and they would start breaking within the first few days and we would have to hold the top on with zip ties. The extra lip at the opening was also a nice addition. Easy cleaning and happy cats.
customer_reviews.author: VAS

customer_reviews.title: Large but nice litter box
customer_reviews.text: We bought this box hoping it would encourage our 12yr old cat to use a litter box after randomly stopping 6mo ago. The box is HUGE, but it does give our cat plenty of privacy. Cleaning has been pretty simple, with the litter staying inside when tipping it over. However, the place our cat pees makes the litter stick to the front edge of the box, not allowing the clumps to fall over and into the drawer. Which means; I still need my spotted shovel to clean that portion out. The other issue is one of the clips is extremely hard to close. I don’t think the top plastic lid and bottom box line up well on that side.
customer_reviews.author: Sfamily

customer_reviews.title: What was I thinking?
customer_reviews.text: I guess this would be okay if you have about six feet of empty floor space to roll this thing around in. I don't have six feet of floor space. I barely have three feet of floor space. You have to almost roll this thing completely on its top to get the solid waste to separate from the litter. This thing stinks to high heaven and my cat hates it almost as much as I do. This is going back as soon as I can get a return slip.
customer_reviews.author: DilbertTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Love this litter box! The only issue I have is that my cat pees on the wall and the litter sticks to it so when it’s time to clean it I do have to use a scooper to scratch that off (I have this issue with all litter boxes, it’s my cat, not the box). This has made it so easy. There is a little bit of litter dust and pieces that come out when I roll it but I don’t mind. It’s worth it and still faster even with sweeping up a little dusk. Love this litter box so much. Totally worth every penny. Assembly was easy for me, everything fit together perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: keena hilliard

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Product- See pictures and please read the entire review
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product, I tried three times. 1st going semi-slow, 2nd attempt slow, 3rd attempt super slow and all three times there was spillage litter. 2 of three attempts most of the litter was in the poop holder. One time I had nothing in the poop holder. Oh and the scooper would not stay in before and after rolling. Also, if you look at the lid after you have rolled the box, the dust factor is crazy and my cat would come out dusty. I am returning this product immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Cleopatra

customer_reviews.title: Best Thing Out There!
customer_reviews.text: I am the mom to seven cats. I own a Litter Robot. I also used high sided litter pans. I HATED constantly scooping. Now I use that Litter Robot and this marvelous Rolln Clean. It actually works EXACTLY as it was described. Well worth the $50. I am buying another. This thing is amazing! Oh, if you have a large cat, I have a CFA registered Maine Coon Cat who weighs 18 pounds, he does just fine. I have been using this for several months now and still think it is great. Just wish it was a bit higher quality. Still, it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Sumrall

customer_reviews.title: I Love It
customer_reviews.text: I really like this litter box. I'll be buying a second one. Maybe even a third. It's not perfect, could be a bit sturdier plastic in spots, however there's nothing even close in the $45 price range. It's this or spend $500 on a litter robot that has no better reviews than this one. I've had it for a few months now and I have to say cleaning the litter box is So much less painful. I don't mind as much and it seems to get the most out of the litter (less wasted). I've recommended this to everyone I know with a cat bottom line.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: screen filter can pop off easily
customer_reviews.text: for the most part it's pretty convenient, i mostly use it as a second box. the only major problem i have with it, is if there's too much litter sand in the box, it pops off the filter screen if you turn it back over. you can either put less send or rotate it back more slowly, but that's a pretty bad design flaw. other than that, it works just fine, and i would have given a higher review
customer_reviews.author: lightinstereo

customer_reviews.title: In theory this is a great idea but it didn’t work at all for my cat.
customer_reviews.text: The little tabs that are supposed to hold the screen in place are not big enough because the screen gets pushed into the clean litter compartment. Then then when you roll the box as described the poop and clumps wind up in the wrong place. Then when you roll it back, the too small tabs stop the screen from flipping back and the hidden compartment is full of dirty litter. Another problem is my cat pees on the sidewalls instead of the floor which clogs the screen. I now have to get another box. Fix those tab holding the screen and it might be really good.
customer_reviews.author: NancyF

customer_reviews.title: Messy
customer_reviews.text: It was working great for about a week and then all of a sudden I noticed the grill that does the sifting to keep it clean was getting Clogged up and kept unhinging. Also you have to roll the surround and some of the waste from the animal gets stuck on the sides and ceiling of the unit it can be quite messy. . I also had to duck tape the seams of the unit where the latches are that hold the top to the bottom, after a while the litter started sifting out as we roll the unit. I’m not happy with my $50 kitty litter box Perhaps I got stuck with a refurbished broken unit
customer_reviews.author: HappyCustomer

customer_reviews.title: I love this litter box!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this litter box almost a month and it is the best one I have ever bought and I have tried almost all of them. Automatic ones are noisy and wakes you up in the middle of the night. Other litter boxes make a huge mess to clean up from cats throwing it around but I haven't had any problems with this one. I plan on getting another one later down the road because I like this one so well. No more back breaking scooping. Like someone else said it's easy on the back. I have back problems and this sure saves me a lot of pain. Great job to the engineer that developed this one.
customer_reviews.author: Janis D

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t purchase again
customer_reviews.text: Did not always roll and get all excrement into disposal cup. The grates that the litter filtered out were not easy to clean. I went back to my old solid sided larger catbox as it is easier to clean. Also it was not sufficient rly large enough for my 14 lb larger cat. He’s tall and long, not fat🙂 I gave it to my daughter that does like this cat box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far
customer_reviews.text: Love it so far. I would have designed it a bit differently and wouldn't have minded paying a bit more for more latches and stuff. But all in all, good value. No issue with litter leaking out. No issue with lots of "clean" litter ending up in the trap. We tilt this bad boy once a day and then we add new litter once a week and give it a scoop incase anything was missed. Pro tip. When you tip it, you really gotta tip it. Don't be afraid. Also, sometimes the pee clumps stick to the box. We just give the bottom a bit of a smack and they come loose.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Q.

customer_reviews.title: Happy Bigger Cat family
customer_reviews.text: We ALL L♥️VE this cat litter box! Our larger (15#) cat has from to do his business without his head sticking out. Hubby happily “rolls” the box to easily clean solid waste and dumps tray contents in the trash can. I am happy because the box is able to properly hold enough litter to actually clump liquids and cover solids. Do not hesitate to purchase this litter box! We purchased it during the COVID-19 lockdown, so shipping was (understandably) delayed, but this product was well worth the wait! If you have a “bigger cat, you will like having this litter box!
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Parker

customer_reviews.title: terrible for cats who pee on sides
customer_reviews.text: This is going to depend on your cat's habits and how well your litter clumps. In my multi cat home one pees on the sides. The sifting grate gets covered in cat pee. So rolling the box around to sift and pull out the tray means pouring cat pee on my hand. The plastic clips are really stiff. And even with banging on the bottom with it upside down, there's still litter clumps I have to scrape off. Dirty litter ends up adhering to the top from rolling it around as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Cahela

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but not worth the price, and it only *kinda*  works
customer_reviews.text: The first day we had this was like litter box heaven! It was magical, amazing, worked like a charm. But with time, we found that only the more solid, hard matter (his poop!) was going into the chute. His urine was sticking in the box and making a mess. I tried different litter, but it didn't help. So I would end up having to pull out this giant litter box, unclip the hinges, scoop...too much! I ended up removing the entire top piece to use as a very expensive open litter box. I'm bummed to have wasted so much money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Hillary G.

customer_reviews.title: Could have been the perfect litter box.
customer_reviews.text: Well, we have had this product for over a year now. I really wanted this to be the one, but at last, I must continue my search!! Every time I roll the box to clean it litter spills out on the floor, plus the "separater" that separates the clean litter from the dirty litter keeps coming out of place. I even put bungee cords around it to try and keep the top on tighter so the litter would not spill out when the box is rolled. If only they used better latches and possibly small hooks on the "seperater", the top would be more secure on the box. Such a shame!!
customer_reviews.author: annette

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: The first time we cleaned it we had no trouble other than some stuck pieces that wouldn't budge, but after that first time it went downhill quick. Second time I went to clean it the plastic sifter popped out even though it was initially secure and so that led to litter and everything all over the floor. Also, after rolling it there were pieces that were stuck around the scooper that wouldn't make it in. Overall this item was a great initial idea, but it is better left just that- an idea. The execution is not necessarily user friendly especially in terms of being sanitary.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn J.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very big item. When I saw it, I decided it would be far to heavy for me to be able to "roll" once filled with kitty litter. I requested a refund, which Amazon referred to Parker Brothers. A few days later, I got an email from Parker Bros. with a fully Pre-Paid Return Label. Very good customer service from this company!
customer_reviews.author: Judy K.

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: It is impossible to truly rotate this and remove the poop drawer without spilling some amount of litter onto the floor. Additionally, the "scoop" inside the box has a slanted edge at its ned that allows for poop/etc to remain in the box. The two other standard litter boxes I have, I use the typical grated shovel to sift the litter and then put the refuse into the Litter Genie. Although I am not perfect, I spill less litter than with this box. So this box does not wind up being more convenient as I need to clean up afterwards more with this box.
customer_reviews.author: William M. Pizzolato

customer_reviews.title: I'm Impressed
customer_reviews.text: More impressed than I thought I would be. I did drill the hole and zip-tied the sifter in to stabilize. I tested it without litter and it popped right out. I should have zipped it on the sides thought. I did on the bottom and now it catches on the mate every time I pull it out to roll it. It's pretty heavy even rolling it but you are done in less than two minutes and that is really nice. My suggestion is to put a door flap on it. Might make it harder to roll but the odor is better contained. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe I've never heard of this product! Hands-down THE best thing for cat owners. Worth ever penny!!!!! Following directions helps, so be mindful of that. And a little stern swat on the bottom when turned upside down frees the clumps from the pan for "collection". This has revolutionized our cat care! Hooray for all!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jill S.

customer_reviews.title: Needs a little space
customer_reviews.text: This is a great litter box, extremely easy to put together and to roll it to clean the litter out. It takes moments to dump all the bad litter away and no litter is spilled in cleaning! The only down sides are not all cats like covered litter boxes. Keep an uncovered litter box 'just in case'. One of my cats refuses to use this box at all. Also, it takes quite a lot of room to rock the box to get all the litter cleaned. Not a good fit for small corner spaces. The extra litter catch tray didn't seem to do much, so if your cat throws litter you might want an additional litter mat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No better than any regular litter box
customer_reviews.text: The was a poor investment. The Roll N Clean doesn’t seem to save me any effort in cleaning as compared to the regular litter box. It’s only a cat litter box, but still.... the quality seems extremely cheap - one example would be the cut out for the scoop to remove the collected waste is rough and unfinished around the edges. The size is humongous. I prefer something more inconspicuous. There are really no benefits that make this rolling box preferable to any litter box. Item returned.
customer_reviews.author: MSRR

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to use. The only reason it’s a 4 star is I wish the area where the cat goes we’re a little bigger. Don’t get me wrong. My cat uses it no problem. It just seems a little smaller than it could be. I used to be the type of guy would wouldn’t clean the litter box. I’d wait till the cat used it for a week or two then throw out all the litter and put fresh litter in. Because this is so easy, I empty it very frequently and am surprised how long the litter actually lasts now.
customer_reviews.author: John Meissner

customer_reviews.title: Very simple concept! Great product for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. You may want a scooper handy still. Sometimes the pee sticks to bottom, you can whack it or scrape with scooper. Also if poop chunks are too small they go through trap, so scooper is nice to use every few days or so. The roll design is pretty simple. Even though I use the scooper to tidy it up it's way easier to use than a regular litter box and keeps the dog out of the litter box! I thought the clips would be metal. They are painted plastic. Would like to see this part improved on their next design.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I love this litterbox!! It saves me so much time from scooping all the clumps of litter, rolling it back and forth is super easy. I installed a door panel in the entrance to prevent litter from flying out, as my cat likes to kick behind her. My only issue with it is that I think my shovel is defective. It does not fit perfectly in the slot compartment and it always needs a few tugs to get it out and a shove to get it back in because it gets stuck halfway. But still love this litterbox!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the best so far!
customer_reviews.text: this by far is my favorite litterbox. It's affordable and does exactly what's described. I no longer scoop affer my cat. Only if the litter sticked to the box whichbrarely happens if you buy a slide non stick litter. Very easy to use and to clean. Just needs a bit of space, since the way of cleaning the litter is by rolling the box to the side. But other than that, I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: Just a very poor design. It looked so cool in the pictures for an easy clean up. "just tip and open the little drawer for the waste" Nope! I put it together correctly (I ordered 2) and when you "roll to the right ALL the sand goes into the drawer. In fact over flows all over onto the floor. It looks good though and the hood does keep the sand in when the cats scratch after doing their business. Just disappointed I still have to scoop and not use (which looked like a good idea) little drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne LaRusch

customer_reviews.title: My review after owning this for 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: After having this for 2 months now, if I could go back I wouldn't have bought this, as I feel it's annoying over time. I was quite excited about this purchase, but it simply does not work quite as well as I hoped. Also, I bought it for my kitten, and now that she's full size, it's a pretty small area for my cat to crap in. I would either stick with a normal box or spring for a really advanced this box isn't that much more convenient for $50. Just my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Cfires

customer_reviews.title: Its ok and does the job
customer_reviews.text: My Cat actually took this very easily. It does help a lot to keep the liter inside instead of all over the floor. I only tried once to roll it, but it didn't go very well...clumps were stuck to the bottom..But no matter- for the price, this enclosed litter pan does the job for our Fur baby. the closure clamps are of a lightweight plastic and it feels like they may break trying to clamp it back together...Time will tell...But I'm not 100% disappointed with this item..
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Quick easy, less mess, takes 20 seconds to clean the litter box!
customer_reviews.text: This updated version is a million time better! I had an older version of this, and the clips were horrible, and kept spilling whenever I would turn/empty it. But this one hasn't given me a single problem. Put it together EMPTY then roll it on it's side to fill, that way you don't overfill it, and end up with a mess.. It takes less than you think, but is soo Soomuch easier than scooping!
customer_reviews.author: Spencer J

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy!!
customer_reviews.text: We had been using a standard litter box for the almost 7 years we’ve had our cat. We’re about to move into a new house and we realized that we needed something different for our new space. This litter box is absolutely incredible!! It’s super easy and quick to clean, it has kept the smell down, and our cat seems to like it. It has met all of our expectations! We were looking at a robot litter box before purchasing this one and I’m so glad we got this instead because it works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: T.H.Ratledge

customer_reviews.title: Broken Upon Arrival
customer_reviews.text: When I first received this product I was super excited because I saw all of the amazing reviews for this product. However, upon receiving this product, the box was smashed and the inside piece to the litter box was broken. The lid does not fit correctly on the box so when I spin it, litter spills out. Also, the smell in this litter box is 10x worse than any generic Walmart litter box I have bought. Personally this litter box is not worth the money. You are better off buying a cheaper one from Walmart or target. I was appalled at the horrible condition I received this litter box in and how much this litter box smells compared to others.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany K

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic litter box upgrade
customer_reviews.text: This litter box is amazing. Not only does it save me money on bags and litter but it does what it says right on the label. I was initially extremely skeptical and it took me a minute to figure out how to get it right but when it works it works. I’m no longer throwing out fresh kitty litter with the bad by the bagful and it is easy to get rid of the drawer full of waste without tedious scooping. Only ding is I wish the drawer was not as flimsy; otherwise a great idea and product.
customer_reviews.author: sundance1220

customer_reviews.title: Great idea...in theory.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this, I really did. That being said, it works well in theory. The interior is small because of the filtering system, so my cats weren’t particularly happy about using it. In addition to that the clamps to seal the lid are extremely difficult to properly latch, and the contents pour out here and there. I use a walnut shell based litter, which was apparently too light for the grate system, because the poop drawer was full to the top with the litter product. It was pricey, and neither cat will use it.
customer_reviews.author: bzybee

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but could be improved
customer_reviews.text: I've bought these multiple times. It beats using a scoop and playing around with my cat's turds periodically, but there's still room for improvement. For instance: the sifting apparatus works well. The unforeseen issue is when you have a weird cat who likes to pee THROUGH the sifter, which creates clumps on the side where there shouldn't be any. You can get them out, but you have to disassemble the sifter, which involved getting your hands dirty in the literal sense. If there was an easier way to do this, and the sifting wall was a bit sturdier, it would be 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: JN901

customer_reviews.title: Top will not stay attached
customer_reviews.text: I was so eager to get this. I have shoulder problems and have trouble cleaning the the litter box. This went together so easy and I was ready to use it. But the top will not stay attached and the litter runs out on the floor. Also the place where the poop is collected will not stay in the unit allowing the clumps of litter to fall out on the floor. I was very upset because now I have a $49 litter box that I have to scoop.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Malott

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as you hope it will be
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this litter box despite the reviews. I don’t mind cleaning the litter box I hate having to remove the top to clean it well So I thought great, but every bad review is correct. The litter gets behind the grate, it doesn’t always end up in the pull out drawer since there is nothing holding it in place. Do t waste your money. Other people have attached a zip tie but for $40 you shouldn’t have to attach anything but what it comes with. 👎
customer_reviews.author: TR1968

customer_reviews.title: Best Clean Up Litter Box for the 💰
customer_reviews.text: OMGosh, I cannot begin to say how glad I am for purchasing this litter box for my 3 cats. The pro's are: easy to clean, saves on litter, and keeps the smell away. Of course the smell depends on the type litter you use as well. As for the cons: NONE to report. At any rate, I highly recommend this litter box. I just ordered a second one for my girl baby kitty because she likes staying in the spare bedroom. Definitely a 5 🌟 product. :)
customer_reviews.author: Leah Kimrey

customer_reviews.title: Poor product
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money. Very disappointed in product. I never write these reviews I don’t like to complain! You have to roll the product back and forth and hope that it doesn’t pop on done. Make sure the clean cat litter comes back by rolling it back to the left or you get a mess in the bottom of the pan, so not worth it. Empty the tray and hope that it did not come out while you were rolling it around! I work 10 hour days and don’t have time to stand there and roll around a cat litter box trying to keep it clean. Amazon do your customers a favor and get rid of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Making life easier one turn at a time!
customer_reviews.text: Making life easier one turn at a time! This box is a must but is best with the litter genie right beside it. I only have one complaint is that you need to make sure the clips are snapped closed otherwise the litter spills when you tilt it. I guess one more worth of mentioning, the clips look metal but are not, they are just as much plastic of the rest of it. From the pictures I thought the clips were metal and in that I assumed more sturdy, but I was wrong. Still a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Candice

customer_reviews.title: Hate it
customer_reviews.text: You have to be sure to have enough space to roll this completely onto its top side then carefully roll it back over. I always need to do this a few times. Gotta also pre scrape the litter bottom before flipping or else the pee clumps will remain sticking on the bottom. Finally ended up just scooping with a regular scoop cuz it was faster, easier, and less messy.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Omega Paw 1 roll litter box
customer_reviews.text: I may have to start using this a regular litter box and take out the sifter/divider. It really is a Great idea and it works perfectly on the kitty poop haha. Unfortunately it can't catch all the urine on the bottom or it breaks up the clumps and the box smells really strong. While I showed how it's used for these pictures, I made sure that all latches were secure. I noticed it's already broken.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Harder to clean than a regular litter box. Threw it away.
customer_reviews.text: I have one 6lb cat. I used the arm and hammer slide clumping litter, as recommended. Any moist litter sticks horribly to grill panel and it's an ordeal to clean this litter box because of that. The roll feature is cumbersome and messy. It does gather the poop in the drawer, which is nice, but then I had to take the whole thing apart to properly clean the pee litter every time. It's a nice concept, but it does not work. I would not recommend. I threw it away within the first week and bought a standard litter box, which my cat and I like much better.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: questionable worth
customer_reviews.text: The product works as advertised in that it will collect the waste in the scoop when directions are followed. The only problem for us is that we have a cat, not a kitten. Cat at 10# is too large for box. We took top off so cat will get into box, which then defeats the purpose of limiting smell. Also, one needs a large area in which to roll the litter box as directed. Otherwise, one is required to move the box or even lift it into a more spacious space. This was an expensive experiment that I would not repeat.
customer_reviews.author: N.McF

customer_reviews.title: Concept OK, but construction shoddy
customer_reviews.text: This might have been a good design idea if the plastic pieces fit together as intended. But the fit is poor, and I'm unable to get the latches to close properly because of the mismatched components. Because of this, litter escapes every time I perform the emptying procedure. Not recommended because of poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Nelson MD

customer_reviews.title: Clumps gather on grate and is infuriating to clean
customer_reviews.text: I bought some really good clumping litter that I love and put it in the this box. Then, my cat proceeds to urinate on the grate that separates the clean and dirty litter when it rolls and close to the sides of the box. This then sticks to the sides and grate and doesn't separate as advertised. So if you have a cat that politely goes in the middle of the box, you'll be OK. Otherwise, avoid this box. I now have to use it like any other box, and it sucks because everything wants to stick to the plastic. SUPER FRUSTRATING
customer_reviews.author: J. Fodor

customer_reviews.title: Nope don’t buy it
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm .... for about 3 days. Then disaster! This made a huge mess and the grate stopped staying in the proper place, Litter had to be scooped in addition to rolling unit (so it became pointless). Smart idea but flawed execution.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm happy with this box compared to a traditional one. I do feel like I have to buy / use more litter. Just recently, two of the latches broke so now I'm probably going to have to get another (right now it's duct taped and working for now) I'm debating whether to buy another of this brand or try a different one that will be more durable. I bought the box in November & writing the review in April.
customer_reviews.author: Splaty

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY PLZ READ
customer_reviews.text: the product was great for about a month. it might work great for a single cat for longer, but now it is starting to fall apart and not hold together at all. litter leaks from the sides and pee gets stuck in the grate/tray. the clips dont clamp anymore. over all a disappointment. i’m not the richest person, so having to get another set of new litter boxes for my four cats is a little irritating. i would not recommend buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Candy Rainey

customer_reviews.title: Glad I took a chance on this!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure how this was going to work but so glad I tried. I decided to get the Elite model for the heavier duty lock tabs . I still take the lid off to scrape urine clumps that tend to stick but it does make cleaning the litter box a little more bearable! :-) I have been searching & comparing for awhile for an easier way to do this job and I didn't want to put $$hundreds into a litter box. A good clumping litter is the best but it don't have to the most expensive to work.
customer_reviews.author: Roxann

customer_reviews.title: Regret not getting this sooner
customer_reviews.text: Honestly such a simple design yet so effective. Really saves time and mess. Always hated digging through the cat litter looking for nasty surprises. A couple tips. Quick spray the bottom with clear silicone lubricant and don't overfill with litter. It slides around better and returns to its spot when you roll it box back. My only regret when buying this is..not getting it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Pete C

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Production and Leaks
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived I was very excited to open the box and set up my new rolling litter box. The first disappointment I had was the cheapness of the product. The product is a more flexible plastic than I expected. The opening for the basket is a cut out of the plastic without anything to support it. The clips do not hold and do not stay closed. The rolling top leaks when rolled and the soiled litter (including the poo) sticks to the bottom on the box. I paid way too much for this product and because I was too excited I threw out the packaging and cannot return. I am seriously disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: D Zygar

customer_reviews.title: I fostered a litter of 5 kittens and their mother for 2 months - and this helped a lot
customer_reviews.text: I bought an Omega Paw Roll n Clean for my 2 cats over 2 years ago. I recently bought a second one. The mother and 5 kittens had 3 access to 3 boxes. With daily cleanings, I struggled to keep 2 uncovered boxes almost clean. The roll n' clean separate the young kittens little clumps & logs very nicely. Worked well with the Corn Litter. Safe for young kittens. Roll N' Clean made several nice improvements over the past couple years.
customer_reviews.author: Brad SF

customer_reviews.title: Revolutionary
customer_reviews.text: I've had cats for 35 years and have never had a litter box this efficient and easy to clean. Although you have to tap the bottom of the box when rolling it to remove the clumped litter it is a far cleaner method of removing the litter. The drawer makes it easy to remove and discard. The added plus is that the smaller opening prevents our snooping dog from exploring the contents. The exit ramp does limit the spread of the litter on the cat's paws when leaving the box but does deposit some of it beneath the ramp - I can deal with that! You'll be happy with your purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: We owned an original Roll n clean and it was great. When it came time to replace it we got this new version. It's awful. When you roll you end up with a bunch of loose litter in with the clumped litter that gets thrown out and wasted. We find we're going through much more litter than before. Also the grate does not stay in place and comes loose, making the entire thing pointless.
customer_reviews.author: Rumi

customer_reviews.title: Great, but not the grate.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best litter box I have used but the grate in the middle is still so weak. (The piece that the litter goes through.) I had the original design and then I upgraded when my grate broke in my first one. Not even a week after buying it, the grate in my new box is already cracking apart. I wish this piece was designed better but other than that it works great! Sometimes the clasps don’t line up well so it can be a pain to close, but that may just be my own fault.
customer_reviews.author: Stefani

customer_reviews.title: you need to add zip ties but a really good box
customer_reviews.text: definitely had to put the zip ties in place tried to put it together without the zip ties and epic fail. The company may want to alter the design so people don't have to drill holes in the litter box. i put tape over the outside of the box where the zip ties are to prevent litter from coming out..thought about using glue but thought what if i have to replace a zip tie so tape it is don't know how long each piece of tape will last but so far so good
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Makes Litter Cleaning a Breeze
customer_reviews.text: This litter box is great! I used to have a standard dome litter box, but the litter cleaning became a drag. It's so much easier to just roll this thing over. I probably would have like an even more automated litter box, but for the price, this is amazing. It seems to fit less litter, so cleaning it is probably a little more frequent, but it's so easy that I don't mind. It's made very well and the latches that hold the top to the bottom are very secure. I just use Arm & Hammer Clump & Seal with it and it works well!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Switala

customer_reviews.title: Leaks, Bad filtering
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't filter extremely well, clumped items have to be fairly large to be filtered out. Smaller clumps or waste get missed and remain in the box. Leaks every time I roll it, generally large mess to clean up. Clips are hard to push down as it never lines up perfectly, thus the clips are likely to break soon as 2 of them seem to be out of place. Was not worth the $40 paid for this. I needed something better as I am disabled, this causes more of a cleanup after than expected.
customer_reviews.author: RavenSkye

customer_reviews.title: Does not roll and clean
customer_reviews.text: I am still irritated with this purchase. Tried to write a review when I first got it cause I knew it wasn't going to work but was not allowed. I have to use this as a regular scoop the poop litter box because none of the pieces fit together. The grate pops out when you roll it making it useless. I got rid of my medium size one so I had to use this and I don't have a way to return a used litter box . The smaller size with the brown lid was perfect. I got this one when I got a second cat and it's miserable, money wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Pryor

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t seem to be constructed super well, as one of the plastic edges on the inside sticks up a little. And if you don’t shake the litterbox right, the poop might not go into the trough the way you want it to. I guess it’s easier than scooping? It has its own issues. But my cat seems to like it alright and I do like that it has the lip to catch some of the litter when she steps out. It’s certainly big enough, and seems to keep the smell down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not All It’s Cracked Up to Be
customer_reviews.text: It’s all made of plastic which is sometimes tough to snap together. I don’t feel like everything is a solid fit - especially the pull-out tray. I did the turn-over cleaning method once and felt like it leaves little bits of dirty litter throughout the whole mechanism. Now I just snap off the lid and clean out litter like normal. So surprised at all of the good reviews. I bought it because of the reviews. Oh well. It’s still usable.
customer_reviews.author: jrenee828

customer_reviews.title: Really good
customer_reviews.text: We've had these before, and now have three new ones. The update is the locking clips. It's still plastic, and it's still not as great as it could be, but it's the best we know of at a reasonable price. I'll never go back to regular litter boxes. We haven't looked at the electric ones lately. At the time that we did (probably 8 years ago), they weren't worth it over these roll types. Tip from others who have left reviews: roll, then "bop" the bottom a few times to release the urine clumps.
customer_reviews.author: A. Feller

customer_reviews.title: Broke after One Month
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these before and it worked pretty decent but I gave it away after my cat passed. This one, however, won't close completely on the back and the clasp in the front broke. Of course it's exactly one month since my purchase so no longer eligible for a refund. But I'm still going to contact Amazon because this unit is cheaply made and broke quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Doesn't Live in Wonderland Anymore

product_meta.title: Omega Paw EL-RA20-1 Roll N Clean Self Separating Self Cleaning Litter Box
product_meta.description: Color:Midnight BlackElite roll 'n clean self cleaning litter box. New and improved with chrome accents and bonus litter step to catch litter as the cat exits.
feature_bullets: Built in "litter step" catches litter as cat exits

Stronger more durable sifting Grill.Material:Plastic.Remove all kitty litter and rinse out with pet-friendly soap and water. Scrub with a soft cloth to remove stubborn stains and litter and use a soft towel to dry and reassemble for use

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
